revised_title: Relaxation Methods for Fluid Percolation Through Porous Materials
tldr: The authors apply relaxation methods to solve engineering problems related to the percolation of fluids through porous materials, such as water leakage through retaining walls. They focus on determining the average pressure and streamlines, which are essential for understanding the flow and pressures induced by the percolation. This method provides accurate results and can be applied to various cases, including those with different strata and anisotropic soils.
